com.team2.shopperhelper
Class ShowProduct

java.lang.Object
  Activity
      com.team2.shopperhelper.ShowProduct

public class ShowProduct
extends Activity

Showing the Product in a List

Since:
8/17/2012
Version:
0.9.0 Instructor: Karl Lloyd
Class: IT482
University: Colorado Technical University
Source Cite: http://www.helloandroid.com/tutorials/connecting-mysql-database and http://geekswithblogs.net/bosuch/archive/2011/01/31/android--- create-a-custom-multi-line-listview-bound-to-an.aspx The ShowProduct class will receive the information from the SearchProduct activity and attempt to pull the information from the PHP site. Once the information is received, it will post it into a custom list view. The list view will have customrow injected with text views to have a customized listing.
Author:
Dana Haywood

Method Detail

onCreate

public void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState)

getListProducts

private java.util.ArrayList<SearchResults> getListProducts(JSONArray listObjects,
                                                           java.util.ArrayList<SearchResults> arrayResults,
                                                           SearchResults pr1,
                                                           int i)
Pulling information from the JSON Array, and putting them into holders. They will then be pushed into an array that is following the format of SearchResults of the Shopper Helper Library. Additionally, adding the maps values to an array.

Parameters:
listObjects - The JSON Array carrying the information
arrayResults - The results that will be feed to the screen.
pr1 - The format the screen will done in.
i - The iteration the procedure call is on.
Returns:
returning the arraylist.

getListObject

private java.lang.String getListObject(java.lang.String value,
                                       JSONArray listObjects,
                                       int i)
                                throws JSONException
Obtaining the item from ListObject to be placed into an ArrayList.

Parameters:
value - The name of the value we are looking for (i.e. inventoryCount)
listObjects2 - The JSONArray that we are searching.
i - The iteration that the procedure call is on.
Returns:
Returning the value to be placed in the list.
Throws:
JSONException

addParms

private void addParms(java.lang.String value,
                      java.util.List<NameValuePair> parms,
                      SharedPreferences setting)
Reducing the amount of times this array is typed out

Parameters:
value - The type of value the item is.
parms - The parms array that we are adding to.
setting - The Preference setting we are using to get the value.

stringChange

private java.lang.String stringChange(java.lang.String type,
                                      java.lang.String value)
Creating a string for the show product screen so it can show price and inventory on the screen.

Parameters:
type - Adding the type of item that it will be shown as (i.e. Price: $)
value - The value that will be the suffix of the type.
Returns:
returns the combined string.
